info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:15PM EDT until April 7 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Sandusky River At Tiffin affecting Seneca County.
For the Sandusky River...including Fremont, Upper Sandusky, Tiffin, Bucyrus...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sandusky River at Tiffin.
* WHEN...Until Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Lowland flooding occurs north and south of the floodwall in Tiffin. Coe Street, Water Street, East Davis Street, and riverside property along Front Street are threatened.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 9.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING
